intro: Crantzia novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand crantzia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Crantzia novae-zelandiae is often found in open habitats and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
